titles: Die Lun√¶ 10. Martii, 1644. It is this day ordered by the Commons assembled in Parliament; that the day of publique thanks-giving, appointed by both Houses to be kept on Wednesday next the 12th. of this instant March, ...
author: England and Wales. Parliament. House of Commons.
notes: Title from heading and first lines of text.
Signed: H. Elsynge Cler. Parl. D. Com.
An order of the House of Commons "that the day of publique thanksgiving appointed to bee kept on 12 March bee observed on all churches and chappels within the lines of communication."
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Public worship --  Great Britain --  Early works to 1800.
